plugins.name: Grid Counter
plugins.description: Grid Counter calculates how many grid columns or rows a selected element spans within its parent frame. To use, simply select an element inside a frame with a layout grid, and the plugin will display the number of columns or rows it spans. It updates in real-time as you select different elements. You can also adjust the grid columns with a click of a button.

accepted.name: Jean Candelier
accepted.description: Front End Web Developer. Former Figma employee.

plugins.tagline: Instantly measure grid spans for any selected element.

111423.name: Grid Counter
111423.description: Grid Counter calculates how many grid columns or rows a selected element spans within its parent frame. To use, simply select an element inside a frame with a layout grid, and the plugin will display the number of columns or rows it spans. It updates in real-time as you select different elements. You can also adjust the grid columns with a click of a button.
111423.release_notes: Fixes bug with elements inside of components with a grid.
111423.tagline: Instantly measure grid spans for any selected element.

plugins.name: Figma variables helper
plugins.description:
Check the variables present in all the nodes of your document.


  1. If a property is in a state that can have a variable but doesnt have one, it generates a warning.
  2. If a property has a variable that doesnt exist in any of the accessible libraries, it generates an error.
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin to help manage variables.

120159.name: Figma variables helper
120159.description:
Check the variables present in all the nodes of your document.


  1. If a property is in a state that can have a variable but doesnt have one, it generates a warning.
  2. If a property has a variable that doesnt exist in any of the accessible libraries, it generates an error.
120159.tagline: A Figma plugin to help manage variables.

plugins.name: EasyMemo
plugins.description:
EasyMemo is a versatile plugin for creating, editing, and managing text memos within Figma. With EasyMemo, you can easily add colorful sticky notes, shapes with text, and simple text nodes to your canvas, helping to keep your workspace organized.


Key Features:


Memo Creation and Editing: Simply enter your text, select your desired memo type, and create memos effortlessly. You can edit memos directly on the canvas, and updates are reflected in real-time.

Customizable Colors: Choose colors from a preset color palette, allowing you to categorize and prioritize memos. The text color automatically adjusts for optimal readability based on the selected background color.

Easy Management:


Organize Memos in a List: Add memos to a list for better organization. You can update or delete memo texts directly from the list. The list is scrollable and always up-to-date.

Batch Generation: Easily generate all listed memos at once. Just click the "Create Shapes" button, and all memos will be neatly arranged on the canvas.

Efficient Layout: Memos are generated in the center of the viewport, focusing on the most relevant areas. They are neatly arranged to avoid overlap.

User-Friendly Interface: The modern and intuitive design features a clearly laid-out text input area, radio buttons for selecting memo types, a color palette, and a dynamically updating list.

How to Use:


Enter Text: Input your memo content in the text input area.

Select Memo Type: Choose from shapes with text, simple text, or sticky notes using the radio buttons.

Pick a Color: Select a color from the palette to categorize your memos. The selected color applies to the memo background, and the text color adjusts automatically.

Add to List: Press the Enter key to add the memo to the list. You can edit or delete memos directly within the list.

Generate Memos: Click the "Create Shapes" button to generate all memos on the canvas at once. Memos are centered in the viewport and neatly arranged.

EasyMemo is the perfect tool for organizing ideas and feedback within your Figma projects. Whether brainstorming, planning, or collaborating, EasyMemo simplifies memo management and supports you efficiently.
plugins.tagline: °广Enter兼间裤с广涓Shape,广Sticky┿般ゃ炽с

plugins.name: ScreenHub
plugins.description:
Introducing the ScreenHub Figma plugin З


Easily way to access and import your collections directly into your design projects.


How it works:


1. Install the Screenhub plugin

2. Sign in or sign up to Screenhub

3. Organize your bookmarks into collections

4. Open the Screenhub plugin from any Figma file

5. Browse and preview your items

6. Click to insert items directly into your design


Questions / Ideas? Contact Us
plugins.tagline: From ScreenHub to Figma in One Click

plugins.name: Rename it - Yu
plugins.description: Sequentially rename layers in ascending order based on how they are put on canvas. (X and Y value). Currently support 3 row in maximum.

20683.name: Rename it - Yu
20683.description: Sequentially rename layers in ascending order based on how they are put on canvas. (X and Y value). Currently support 3 row in maximum.

plugins.name: Sentence case checker and converter
plugins.description:
Make your typography clean, consistent, and user-friendly.


Sentence Case Checker helps you scan all visible text layers in a selected frame and highlights any unintended capital letters mid-sentence like those annoying This Is a Sentence errors.


Detect sentence casing issues

Shows all problematic phrases in a list

Locate each error directly on canvas

Convert individual words or fix all in one click

Real-time refresh when changing selection


Supports UI writing best practices and editorial consistency!
plugins.tagline: Automatically detect and fix mid-sentence capitalization issues in your Figma designs.

130908.name: Sentence case checker and converter
130908.description:
Make your typography clean, consistent, and user-friendly.


Sentence Case Checker helps you scan all visible text layers in a selected frame and highlights any unintended capital letters mid-sentence like those annoying This Is a Sentence errors.


Detect sentence casing issues

Shows all problematic phrases in a list

Locate each error directly on canvas

Convert individual words or fix all in one click

Real-time refresh when changing selection


Supports UI writing best practices and editorial consistency!
130908.release_notes:
Improved sentence casing logic:
 Capitalized words after ., ?, or ! are no longer incorrectly flagged.
 Better handling of sentence boundaries to reduce false positives.
This update makes the plugin smarter and more accurate for real-world content.
130908.tagline: Automatically detect and fix mid-sentence capitalization issues in your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Smart Selection
plugins.description:
Smart Selection is a powerful tool for designers that allows flexible filtering of elements based on multiple parameters: dimensions, names, types, properties, and even child element content.


The plugin enables you to:

  1. Filter elements by exact values, ranges, and regular expressions
  2. Find objects with specific child elements
  3. Save, load, and combine sets of selected elements
  4. Export and import selection sets to share between files and teams
  5. Use an intuitive interface with convenient filters


Essential for working with complex designs when you need to quickly find elements with specific characteristics save time on routine selection tasks and start working more efficiently.
plugins.tagline: Advanced element selection by parameters and saving selection sets for quick reuse.

128513.name: Smart Selection
128513.description:
Smart Selection is a powerful tool for designers that allows flexible filtering of elements based on multiple parameters: dimensions, names, types, properties, and even child element content.


The plugin enables you to:

  1. Filter elements by exact values, ranges, and regular expressions
  2. Find objects with specific child elements
  3. Save, load, and combine sets of selected elements
  4. Export and import selection sets to share between files and teams
  5. Use an intuitive interface with convenient filters


Essential for working with complex designs when you need to quickly find elements with specific characteristics save time on routine selection tasks and start working more efficiently.
128513.release_notes: Added the ability to select child element. Enable the "Select matching child elements" option for that
128513.tagline: Advanced element selection by parameters and saving selection sets for quick reuse.

plugins.name: Viewport Marker
plugins.description:
Viewport Marker is a fun and easy-to-use plugin for Figma that lets you visually add custom viewport sizes to your designs .


With just a few clicks, you can create viewport markers in any height, helping you quickly see which areas will be visible on different screen sizes.
plugins.tagline: Easily create and manage viewport markers for precise design layouts ㄢ

128326.name: Viewport Marker
128326.description:
Viewport Marker is a fun and easy-to-use plugin for Figma that lets you visually add custom viewport sizes to your designs .


With just a few clicks, you can create viewport markers in any height, helping you quickly see which areas will be visible on different screen sizes.
128326.tagline: Easily create and manage viewport markers for precise design layouts ㄢ

plugins.name: Flatten to Image
plugins.description:
This plugin flattens each selected layer into a single image. It can either replace the original layers or create a copy to the right. You can also select desired format, and resolution.

Works similar to "Copy as PNG" option, but you don't have to do it multiple times if you have a lot of layers, nor export them and import again.
plugins.tagline: Transform selected layers into flattened PNGs or JPGs in bulk.

126298.name: Flatten to Image
126298.description:
This plugin flattens each selected layer into a single image. It can either replace the original layers or create a copy to the right. You can also select desired format, and resolution.

Works similar to "Copy as PNG" option, but you don't have to do it multiple times if you have a lot of layers, nor export them and import again.
126298.tagline: Transform selected layers into flattened PNGs or JPGs in bulk.

plugins.name: Frame to JSON - AI-powered Design-to-Code Converter
plugins.description:
What is it?

A powerful Figma plugin that transforms your design frames into structured JSON data, ensuring seamless developer handoff and design-to-code consistency.


Key Features

AI-powered frame analysis

One-click frame-to-JSON conversion

Complete hierarchy and style preservation

Customizable export options

Developer-friendly structured output


How to Use

1.Select your target frame(s) in Figma

2.Launch the Frame to JSON plugin

3.Review the extracted structure and properties

4.Click Generate JSON

5.Copy or download the JSON output instantly


锔 What Youll Need

Figma design frames


Security Note

Your data is processed securely, with no external storage. The plugin ensures precise design-to-code conversion while maintaining full control over your export preferences. No more manual adjustmentslet AI handle the complexity!
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma frames into clean JSON with one click your design-to-development bridge made simple!

How to Use

2.Launch the Frame to JSON plugin

3.Review the extracted structure and properties

4.Click Generate JSON

锔 What Youll Need

Figma design frames

128053.tagline: Transform Figma frames into clean JSON with one click your design-to-development bridge made simple!

plugins.name: MAPPE  Mini map for Figma
plugins.description:
The figma area (if we take the entire canvas) is 262,000 x 262,000 pixels. If there are few screens and they are small, you do not think about the actual canvas size. But when there are a lot of layouts, at some point you run into the edge of the canvas. At this point, you understand that it becomes impossible to navigate in figma.


MAPPE makes navigation in big files easier. The plugin shows where are you exactly on the canvas.

accepted.name: Roman Nebel
accepted.description: IT Manager / UX Expert / Pet-projects Developer

plugins.tagline: Easy navigation through large figma files

119919.name: MAPPE  Mini map for Figma
119919.description:
The figma area (if we take the entire canvas) is 262,000 x 262,000 pixels. If there are few screens and they are small, you do not think about the actual canvas size. But when there are a lot of layouts, at some point you run into the edge of the canvas. At this point, you understand that it becomes impossible to navigate in figma.


MAPPE makes navigation in big files easier. The plugin shows where are you exactly on the canvas.
119919.release_notes:
1.0  Feel FREE!

Plugin now is absolutely free and open-source.
119919.tagline: Easy navigation through large figma files

plugins.name: PixelTweak
plugins.description:
PixelTweak is a simple yet powerful tool that helps you achieve pixel-perfect design. It smooths edges, rounds numbers, and aligns elements with just one click.


  1. Select your layers Choose the layer or layers you want to perfect
  2. Hit the Tweak button One click is all it takes to activate the magic!
  3. Watch the transformation PixelTweak goes to work, smoothing out edges, rounding numbers, and aligning everything for a sleek, professional finish. It doesnt just stop at the selected layersit fine-tunes every child element for complete perfection.
plugins.tagline: Achieve pixel-perfect precision with a single click

122972.name: PixelTweak
122972.description:
PixelTweak is a simple yet powerful tool that helps you achieve pixel-perfect design. It smooths edges, rounds numbers, and aligns elements with just one click.


  1. Select your layers Choose the layer or layers you want to perfect
  2. Hit the Tweak button One click is all it takes to activate the magic!
  3. Watch the transformation PixelTweak goes to work, smoothing out edges, rounding numbers, and aligning everything for a sleek, professional finish. It doesnt just stop at the selected layersit fine-tunes every child element for complete perfection.
122972.tagline: Achieve pixel-perfect precision with a single click

plugins.name: Condens
plugins.description:
With the Condens plugin, you can quickly import highlights from Condens into FigJam. This keeps your insights intact, preserving key details like participant names and links back to the original data.


Perfect for brainstorming, organizing ideas, and running synthesis workshops with your team without losing the context behind your research, even when switching between tools.


How it works:

  1. Export your highlights from Condens as a CSV file.
  2. Open the Condens plugin in FigJam and upload the CSV file.
  3. Your Highlights are instantly converted into sticky notes, complete with the respondents name and a direct link back to the original data in Condens, ready to use in your FigJam board.


Contact us for support, book a demo to get a personalized walkthrough, or visit our Help Center for more information.

If you're not using Condens yet, start your free 15-day trial at condens.io.
plugins.tagline: Import Highlights from Condens into Figjam

105161.description:

How it works:

  1. Export your highlights from Condens as a CSV file.
  2. Open the Condens plugin in FigJam and upload the CSV file.
  3. Your Highlights are instantly converted into sticky notes, complete with the respondents name and a direct link back to the original data in Condens, ready to use in your FigJam board.


Contact us for support, book a demo to get a personalized walkthrough, or visit our Help Center for more information.

105161.tagline: Import Highlights from Condens into Figjam

plugins.name: NiceApps plugin
plugins.description: Enhance your design with the Figma component style downloader plugin, seamlessly integrating with NiceApps. This powerful tool allows you to effortlessly download component styles from Figma and utilize them within your NiceApps application, ensuring consistency and efficiency in your design process. Simplify your development and unleash the full potential of Figma and NiceApps with this time-saving plugin.

Simplify your development and unleash the full potential of Figma and NiceApps with this time-saving plugin.

plugins.name: Tazym
plugins.description:
Introducing Tazym, the ultimate Figma plugin that streamlines the design-to-web process. With Tazym, you can effortlessly upload your designs to the cloud, generating a unique URL that allows you to update your design in Figma in real-time. Say goodbye to manual website updates or the need to rely on developers. With Tazym, you are the creator, and you own your designs.


Getting started with Tazym is easy. Simply select your design, name it, choose a format (SVG, PNG, or JPG), and voila - you have a URL that can be used anywhere to showcase your work. When inspiration strikes and you want to make updates, it's as easy as editing in Figma and hitting the Update button in Tazym. Your users will see your latest creations instantly.


Ready to take control of your designs and streamline your workflow? Visit tazym.com to learn more and start using Tazym today!
plugins.tagline: Export your Figma designs to URLs. Edit them any time.

54957.name: Tazym
54957.description:
Introducing Tazym, the ultimate Figma plugin that streamlines the design-to-web process. With Tazym, you can effortlessly upload your designs to the cloud, generating a unique URL that allows you to update your design in Figma in real-time. Say goodbye to manual website updates or the need to rely on developers. With Tazym, you are the creator, and you own your designs.


Getting started with Tazym is easy. Simply select your design, name it, choose a format (SVG, PNG, or JPG), and voila - you have a URL that can be used anywhere to showcase your work. When inspiration strikes and you want to make updates, it's as easy as editing in Figma and hitting the Update button in Tazym. Your users will see your latest creations instantly.


Ready to take control of your designs and streamline your workflow? Visit tazym.com to learn more and start using Tazym today!
54957.tagline: Export your Figma designs to URLs. Edit them any time.

No external tools required: design, iterate, and refine without ever leaving Figma.

131753.tagline: Generate high-quality, customizable images from text prompts- integrated into your Figma workflow

plugins.name: CSS Variables to Figma
plugins.description:
Import css variables into Figma variables

This plugin enables you import color variables from CSS into Figma, supporting both single-mode and dual Light/Dark mode setups. It maps your CSS variables to Figma's variable modes, converting formats like OKLCH (Tailwind), HEX, RGBA, and RGB into Figma-compatible HEX values. OKLCH, P3, and HCT color values are also preserved and attached to each variable for reference.


Example:


.light {
--color-primary: #000;
}
.dark {
--color-primary: #fff;
}


How it works:

  1. Paste your CSS variables in the text area below.
  2. Click "Export to JSON" to generate a Figma-compatible variables file.
  3. Import the JSON file into Figma using the Figma Variables by Honza Toman


Watch video how it works.


Currently supported:

  1. Color variables
  2. Attach oklch, p3 colors and HCT values to variable syntax


Next updates:

  1. Border radius variables
  2. Spacing variables
  3. Shadows
  4. ...


Feedback and support

  1. Let us know your feedback and suggestions! @sans_sherif
  2. Support the development of this plugin buy us a coffee
plugins.tagline: Import existing css variables to figma variables

133956.name: CSS Variables to Figma
133956.description:
Import css variables into Figma variables

This plugin enables you import color variables from CSS into Figma, supporting both single-mode and dual Light/Dark mode setups. It maps your CSS variables to Figma's variable modes, converting formats like OKLCH (Tailwind), HEX, RGBA, and RGB into Figma-compatible HEX values. OKLCH, P3, and HCT color values are also preserved and attached to each variable for reference.


Example:


.light {
--color-primary: #000;
}
.dark {
--color-primary: #fff;
}


How it works:

  1. Paste your CSS variables in the text area below.
  2. Click "Export to JSON" to generate a Figma-compatible variables file.
  3. Import the JSON file into Figma using the Figma Variables by Honza Toman


Watch video how it works.


Currently supported:

  1. Color variables
  2. Attach oklch, p3 colors and HCT values to variable syntax


Next updates:

  1. Border radius variables
  2. Spacing variables
  3. Shadows
  4. ...


Feedback and support

  1. Let us know your feedback and suggestions! @sans_sherif
  2. Support the development of this plugin buy us a coffee
133956.tagline: Import existing css variables to figma variables

plugins.name: Your AI Co-Pilot
plugins.description:
Your AI Co-Pilot provides instant design feedback directly within Figma. Select any design elements to receive AI-powered analysis across four key areas:


UI Design: Visual hierarchy, color usage, spacing, and consistency

Content: Readability, clarity, and copy suggestions

User Experience: Usability issues and interaction patterns

Accessibility: WCAG compliance recommendations


The plugin analyzes selected frames, components, or groups and generates actionable feedback to improve your designs. You can ask follow-up questions to get more detailed explanations or recommendations.


All analysis is performed securely through our backend API using advanced AI models. No design data is stored permanently - it's only processed temporarily during analysis.
plugins.tagline: Instant AI feedback on your designs

129161.name: Your AI Co-Pilot
129161.description:
Your AI Co-Pilot provides instant design feedback directly within Figma. Select any design elements to receive AI-powered analysis across four key areas:


UI Design: Visual hierarchy, color usage, spacing, and consistency

Content: Readability, clarity, and copy suggestions

User Experience: Usability issues and interaction patterns

Accessibility: WCAG compliance recommendations


The plugin analyzes selected frames, components, or groups and generates actionable feedback to improve your designs. You can ask follow-up questions to get more detailed explanations or recommendations.


All analysis is performed securely through our backend API using advanced AI models. No design data is stored permanently - it's only processed temporarily during analysis.

129161.tagline: Instant AI feedback on your designs

plugins.name: Archiver
plugins.description:
Archiver is a streamlined utility that helps you declutter your Figma workspace without losing valuable design history. With a single click, it automatically moves selected elements to a dedicated Archive page, organizing them chronologically by date.


Unlike manual archiving, this plugin:

  1. Preserves all properties including auto layout, components, and text styling
  2. Intelligently arranges archived items by date for easy retrieval
  3. Handles any element type (frames, components, vectors, text, etc.)
  4. Works with batch selections for efficient cleanup
  5. Maintains a clear naming convention with date stamps


Perfect for design teams that need to keep their working files clean while maintaining access to previous iterations, explorations, or unused concepts. Simply select what you want to archive, run the plugin, and continue designing with a cleaner workspace.
plugins.tagline: Organize Design History: One-Click Element Archiving

128151.name: Archiver
128151.description:
Archiver is a streamlined utility that helps you declutter your Figma workspace without losing valuable design history. With a single click, it automatically moves selected elements to a dedicated Archive page, organizing them chronologically by date.


Unlike manual archiving, this plugin:

  1. Preserves all properties including auto layout, components, and text styling
  2. Intelligently arranges archived items by date for easy retrieval
  3. Handles any element type (frames, components, vectors, text, etc.)
  4. Works with batch selections for efficient cleanup
  5. Maintains a clear naming convention with date stamps


Perfect for design teams that need to keep their working files clean while maintaining access to previous iterations, explorations, or unused concepts. Simply select what you want to archive, run the plugin, and continue designing with a cleaner workspace.
128151.release_notes:
Key fixes:

Added await figma.loadAllPagesAsync() at the beginning to ensure all pages are loaded
Added await archivePage.loadAsync() when finding the Archive page
Added null checks before accessing archivePage.children
Made the code more defensive with additional checks throughout
128151.tagline: Organize Design History: One-Click Element Archiving

plugins.name: Countastic
plugins.description:
Countastic is the ultimate Figma calculator plugin, built to help product designers create data-centric products and screens faster and more efficiently.


Add, subtract, calculate averages and percentages automatically and use them in your designs with a single click, making the data on screen believable and relevant to your customers, stakeholders and usability test participants.


A must have for any designer sweating the details of data tables, sales and analytics dashboards, finance or e-commerce products.


Get the license

(7 day trial, team discounts available)


Get started

Countastic performs calculations on objects selected in your Figma file, showing you results you can copy or place on the canvas with a single click.


Open Countastic and:

  1. Select two or more text objects in your Figma file
  2. See the sum, difference, average and percentage difference of the selected objects.
  3. Click the result of a calculation to copy to clipboard
  4. Click the Place button beside the calculation to add the result to the canvas


Countastic works with:

  1. Currencies (including US, UK and European separator and decimal point styles)
  2. Units of measure
  3. Any numerical values containing prefixes or suffixes


Countastic helps you calculate:

  1. Sums
  2. Differences
  3. Averages
  4. Percentage differences (between 2 objects only)


Get the license

(7 day trial, team discounts available)


Questions and feedback

Countastic requires no setup, allowing you to hit the ground running and use relevant, real-looking data in your designs.


If you have feedback about Countastic or want to share an idea or a feature request, drop me a line on X, Bluesky or Threads.
plugins.tagline: A fully-automated calculator inside Figma

plugins.name: Text Style Mapping
plugins.description:
Text Style Mapping simplifies the process of applying text styles to multiple text layers in your Figma designs.


Features:

  1. Apply text styles to both styled and unstyled text layers at once
  2. Automatically groups similar unstyled text based on font family, weight, size, and line height
  3. Switch between styled and unstyled text with an easy tab interface
  4. Works with your existing text styles library


How to use:

  1. Select a frame containing text elements
  2. Choose text styles from the dropdown menus
  3. Click "Apply Styles" to update all selected text layers at once


Note: This plugin may have limitations when working with text styles that use design tokens or local variables due to Figma API constraints.


This plugin helps maintain design consistency by making text styling quick and efficient across your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Super Tint Generator
plugins.description:
Super Tint Generator

Transform any colour into a harmonious palette with the Super Tint Generator plugin. Perfect for UI design systems, branding, and visual hierarchy.


Features:

- Generate multiple tints from any base color

- Customize number of variations (2-20)

- Choose between lightening and darkening modes

- Automatically organized in Figma frames

- Instant preview of color variations


Ideal for:

- Design system creation

- Brand palette exploration

- UI component variations

- Gradient alternatives

- Color accessibility testing


Simple to use: Pick a color, set tint count, choose adjustment type, and generate your palette.

Keep historical brand knowledge in one place to easily find exactly the language you're looking for.

Keep your data safe and secure in the cloud instead of in someone's head or filing cabinet.

plugins.name: Feature-Labeler
plugins.description:
Create numbered badges and description frames for your wireframes with ease. Streamline your design documentation process by adding sequential numbered references to features and their explanations. Convenient for product specifications, user flow documentation, and design handoffs.


  1. Create a Number Badge
  2. Select the badge size (small, medium, or large)
  3. Choose a color from preset options or use the color picker
  4. Click "Create" to add a numbered badge to your design
  5. Create a Description Frame
  6. Select the frame size (small, medium, or large)
  7. Click "Create" to add a description frame with a matching number
  8. Edit Badges and Descriptions
  9. Click on any badge or description frame to edit
  10. Change numbers to reorder the sequence automatically
  11. For badges, you can also update the color
  12. Organize Documentation
  13. Place badges next to UI elements you want to reference
  14. Add explanatory text in the description frames
  15. Badges and descriptions with the same number are linked in the sequence

plugins.name: HubSpot Developers: UI Extensions Auto Card Builder
plugins.description:
Welcome to the HubSpot Developers Figma Plugin for our UI Extensions Figma Design Kit

This plugin is brought to you by HubSpot DevRel Labs, an initiative to create solutions for developers to thrive while building with HubSpot.


Requirements: HubSpot UI Extensions Figma Design Kit


Create amazing HubSpot UI Extensions designs in minutes. Do you need to prototype a UI Extension quickly for your clients? Well, now you can with the HubSpot UI Extensions Figma plugin. Download the Figma Design Kit, install this plugin and choose from our library of UI components. Add multiple of the same components to a card, order them in any way you'd like, and watch the magic happen as the UI extension is built for you.


Upcoming Features

  1. Add pre-defined use-cases to choose from that will auto-populate the card with the appropriate components.
  2. Add a way to auto-generate the UI Extension code from the components you choose.


Please leave any and all feedback for this plugin on our Feedback form. Please specify that you're sharing feedback for our Figma UI Extension Builder plugin.

---------------

Made with А by the HubSpot DevRel Team.

Learn more about UI Extensions on our developer documentation site.

HubSpot UI Extensions are currently in beta and subject to the Early Adopter Program terms. Read the terms.
plugins.tagline: Create UI Extension cards with the click of a button.

Download the Figma Design Kit, install this plugin and choose from our library of UI components. Add multiple of the same components to a card, order them in any way you'd like, and watch the magic happen as the UI extension is built for you.

  2. Add a way to auto-generate the UI Extension code from the components you choose.

plugins.name: Class Action
plugins.description:
Class Action is a powerful CSS-like styling tool that revolutionizes how designers work with consistent design tokens and variables in Figma. Create Tailwind-inspired class libraries, UI kits, and design templates with ease, then apply saved styles instantly to other frames with a single click.


Key features:

  1. Create and manage reusable style classes similar to CSS and Tailwind classes
  2. Build and apply complete UI kits and design templates across multiple frames
  3. Preserve Figma variables, color tokens, and style references in your templates
  4. Full support for Tailwind-like utility classes, component styles, and design tokens
  5. Premium version with unlimited style classes and advanced template management


Class Action brings CSS and Tailwind-inspired workflows to Figma by eliminating repetitive styling tasks. Perfect for design systems, UI kit creation, template libraries, and maintaining visual consistency across projects. Save time, reduce styling errors, and keep your designs perfectly aligned with your component library or Tailwind-like system.


Compatible with both light and dark Figma themes, supports variable tokens for responsive templates, and optimized for performance even in large UI kit files with complex component libraries.
plugins.tagline: Think as a designer, act like a developer.

139778.name: Class Action
139778.description:
Class Action is a powerful CSS-like styling tool that revolutionizes how designers work with consistent design tokens and variables in Figma. Create Tailwind-inspired class libraries, UI kits, and design templates with ease, then apply saved styles instantly to other frames with a single click.


Key features:

  1. Create and manage reusable style classes similar to CSS and Tailwind classes
  2. Build and apply complete UI kits and design templates across multiple frames
  3. Preserve Figma variables, color tokens, and style references in your templates
  4. Full support for Tailwind-like utility classes, component styles, and design tokens
  5. Premium version with unlimited style classes and advanced template management


Class Action brings CSS and Tailwind-inspired workflows to Figma by eliminating repetitive styling tasks. Perfect for design systems, UI kit creation, template libraries, and maintaining visual consistency across projects. Save time, reduce styling errors, and keep your designs perfectly aligned with your component library or Tailwind-like system.


Compatible with both light and dark Figma themes, supports variable tokens for responsive templates, and optimized for performance even in large UI kit files with complex component libraries.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs to communicate with the Lemon Squeezy API for license validation and activation.

139778.release_notes:
This major update introduces an advanced class organization system that gives premium users complete control over their design workflow. The new drag-and-drop functionality transforms how you manage and organize your saved classes with an intuitive and powerful interface.
New in this release:

 Premium Class Organization: Exclusive drag-and-drop reordering system that allows premium users to customize their class list order for optimal workflow efficiency
Intuitive Drag-and-Drop: Simply drag classes to reorder them exactly how you want, with smooth animations and visual feedback that makes organization effortless
 Keyboard Shortcuts: Full accessibility support with Ctrl+Arrow key shortcuts for quick class reordering without using the mouse
Cross-Device Support: Works seamlessly across all browsers and devices, including native touch support for tablet and mobile design work
Smart Search Integration: Drag-and-drop automatically adapts when searching, ensuring consistent behavior across all interaction modes
Persistent Organization: Your custom class order is automatically saved and restored, maintaining your preferred workflow setup across design sessions

This premium enhancement empowers advanced users with professional-grade class management capabilities, making class organization a seamless and personalized part of your design process. Take control of your workflow and arrange your classes exactly how you work best.
139778.tagline: Think as a designer, act like a developer.

plugins.name: Design Review Notes
plugins.description:
Streamline your design review process with an easy-to-use annotation tool for Figma. Select any object or frame, add comments, and assign a review status to keep your team aligned. Statuses are:

  1. Review Needed
  2. Approved
  3. Changes Needed
  4. Not Ready


If you have suggested for additional statuses or new features, let me know.


This tool is perfect for both async teams or capturing meeting notes during design critiques, this plugin helps designers flag areas for review and allows reviewers to provide structured feedback with full traceability. Capture design decisions, document revisions, and ensure clear communication, whether for quick approvals or in-depth discussions.


Mark design elements for review

Assign statuses for clarity

Capture feedback & decisions in context

Improve async collaboration & meeting documentation


Keep your design process transparent and efficient. Try it now!
plugins.tagline: Select objects in your file to quickly annotate and add a review status.

122232.name: Design Review Notes
122232.description:
Streamline your design review process with an easy-to-use annotation tool for Figma. Select any object or frame, add comments, and assign a review status to keep your team aligned. Statuses are:

  1. Review Needed
  2. Approved
  3. Changes Needed
  4. Not Ready


If you have suggested for additional statuses or new features, let me know.


This tool is perfect for both async teams or capturing meeting notes during design critiques, this plugin helps designers flag areas for review and allows reviewers to provide structured feedback with full traceability. Capture design decisions, document revisions, and ensure clear communication, whether for quick approvals or in-depth discussions.


Mark design elements for review

Assign statuses for clarity

Capture feedback & decisions in context

Improve async collaboration & meeting documentation


Keep your design process transparent and efficient. Try it now!
122232.tagline: Select objects in your file to quickly annotate and add a review status.

plugins.name: Publish Ninja - Publish websites directly from Figma
plugins.description:
Turn your designs into live websites directly from Figma!

With Publish Ninja, you can instantly turn your Figma designs into fully functional, responsive websites directly from Figma.


Try it free! - We offer a 7-day free trial so you can experience publishing directly from Figma.


Why use Publish Ninja?

Youve designed a website in Figma, but now youre stuck. Either you need a developer, or you have to wrestle with complicated website builders. Its frustrating, time-consuming, and slows you down.


Publish Ninja lets you publish fully responsive websites directly from Figmano coding needed. With just a few clicks, your design goes live as a website.


How it Works

  1. Design in Figma Create your site just like any other Figma project.
  2. Customize responsiveness Easily adjust layouts for mobile, tablet, and desktop.
  3. Publish instantly One click, and your website is live!


Why Choose Publish Ninja?


No-Code website builder No technical skills required.

Live in seconds Skip the hassle of exporting and coding.

Custom domains Publish on your own domain with ease.

SEO-optimized Built-in performance & search engine best practices.

Seamlessly publish directly to the web-no coding needed.

plugins.name: Margin Detective
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to inconsistencies and hello to perfectly aligned designs. With Margin Detective, you get a vigilant partner that scans your frames, checks margins and spacings, and ensures they align with your document variables. When somethings off, it offers smart corrections or swaps, keeping your design cohesive and professional.


Whether youre fine-tuning layouts or auditing a massive project, Margin Detective empowers you to maintain flawless alignment, harmony, and consistencyall with the efficiency of a true design detective.


Design smarter. Stay consistent. Every pixel, every time.
plugins.tagline: Detect. Correct. Perfect your design.

plugins.name: MultiText Inserter
plugins.description:
MultiText Inserter helps you quickly create multiple text fields in your designs all at once. Instead of adding each text box one by one, you can enter all your text at once, set the font size, color, and style, and the plugin will generate all the text fields for you automatically. It's a real time-saver for designers who need to add lists of text elements.


Example of Footer Content:


"About Us"

"Contact"

"Privacy Policy"

"Terms of Service"

"漏 2023 Your Company Name"

You can input these lines into the plugin, and it will create individual text fields for each item, styled according to your settings.

accepted.name: Muhiris
accepted.description: Love getting paid for something I do for fun.

plugins.tagline: Multitext Inserter to save time and make you productive

plugins.name: Instance Find - Pro
plugins.description:
Keeping your design system up-to-date is now easier than ever! With Instance Find-Pro, you can effortlessly search across all the pages impacted by your components and make any necessary changes.


It also generates a handy CSV file that you can share with developers to streamline tracking.


Id love for you to try it out and share your feedback! As this is my first plugin, Im always looking to improve and grow, and your input would mean the world to me. Theres always room to get better!
plugins.tagline: Find, navigate through, and download a CSV file listing all instances of a component within a file.

plugins.name: Figma to inspecta - compare design to web
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin works with inspecta Chrome extension, enhancing your design QA workflow.


Download the Chrome extension: inspecta - Visual QA and CSS editor


How to use the Figma to Inspecta plugin

  1. Install the plugin: Add the plugin to your Figma workspace.
  2. Copy color styles and variables
  3. Paste and compare in Inspecta:
  4. Open your webpage.
  5. Launch the Inspecta Chrome extension.
  6. Click "Paste & Compare Figma colors" to analyze and match colors between Figma and your live webpage.
plugins.tagline: Auto compare Figma color styles and variables with your webpage colors
